labels.analysis: The Exa AI Search Server primarily enables AI assistants to perform various types of web searches, including real-time searches, academic paper searches, and social media queries. It focuses on delivering optimized and relevant results while providing tools for comprehensive company research, competitor analysis, and content extraction from URLs. The server is designed to enhance AI-driven insights by tailoring search capabilities based on specific needs. The available tool, "Optional Settings," suggests the ability to access and manage servers, indicating some level of configuration capability.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is "Web Search & Research" because the core functionality revolves around performing searches (web, academic, social media) and gathering information. The secondary label "Data Analysis & Processing" is included because the server enhances insights and research through data extraction and analysis. "Content Creation" is another relevant label since the server helps in extracting and processing content from URLs. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: Exa AI Search Server
server_info_crawled.author: @jackedelic/exa-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI assistants to perform real-time web searches, academic paper searches, and social media queries with optimized and relevant results. Access comprehensive company research, competitor analysis, and content extraction from URLs to enhance AI-driven insights. Customize tool selection to tailor search capabilities for your specific needs.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@jackedelic/exa-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
